availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Deatherage (Madison Co., KY, farmer & justice of the peace)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Jane McKinney Deatherage in Madison County in October 1850. Father of Josiah Deatherage, Allen Deatherage, Samuel Deatherage, and George William Deatherage. Guardian of Andrew Clay in 1860. Farmer in Madison County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Madison County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision 2, p. 458A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Union, pp. 271A-B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183315, p. 539.
